intro: Priestleya sericea, commonly known as the silky priestleya, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Agavaceae and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, silvery-gray leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences bearing small, white or pale blue flowers. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Priestleya sericea is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance in landscaping.
